title: Coronavirus: Fake and misleading stories that went viral this week
description: A global look at Covid-19 rumours and disinformation.

title: The climber who bagged all 282 Munros in one winter
description: Kevin Woods battled through storms to complete all of Scotland's Munros in one winter season.

title: Week in pictures: 28 March - 3 April 2020
description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

title: Coronavirus: How to see the world without leaving your home
description: Coronavirus has restricted travel, but it doesn't have to restrict our imagination.

title: Coronavirus: Russia uses facial recognition to tackle Covid-19
description: As Russian cities go into lockdown to try to contain coronavirus, Moscow uses the latest technology to keep track of residents.

title: Coronavirus: Garden goals getting pro-commentary
description: BBC commentary has been added to the video clips which were collated by Port Vale Foundation Trust.

title: Anthony Yarde: Second family member dies from coronavirus
description: British boxer Anthony Yarde's grandmother dies from coronavirus, a week after his father's death.

title: My Money: 'People have started leaving their houses again'
description: As part of a BBC blog series, Jen Smith talks us through one week as pandemic restrictions ease in Shenzhen.

title: Virtual Grand National: Runners, riders, odds for race to benefit NHS
description: The actual Grand National may be off, but Saturday will still feature a televised Virtual Grand National.

title: Coronavirus: Test goal will take 'huge amount of work', says Hancock
description: The health secretary has promised 100,000 tests a day but there are questions about how it will be achieved.

title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson stays isolated with mild symptoms
description: Boris Johnson says he still has mild symptoms and will continue to work from home in Downing Street.

title: Coronavirus deaths in Scotland increase by 46
description: The total number of confirmed deaths across the country is now 172, Nicola Sturgeon says.

title: Coronavirus: Nurse Areema Nasreen dies with Covid-19
description: The reportedly previously healthy mother-of-three died at Walsall Manor Hospital where she worked.

title: Coronavirus: Europe's care homes struggle as deaths rise
description: France reveals 884 deaths linked to coronavirus and more cases emerge in Spain and Italy.

title: Coronavirus: Nightingale Hospital opens at London's ExCel centre
description: The new NHS Nightingale hospital shows "how the impossible could be made possible", says Prince Charles.

title: Coronavirus: How NHS Nightingale was built in just nine days
description: How London's ExCel centre was transformed into a hospital to treat coronavirus patients.

title: Teachers to grade students for cancelled exams
description: Teachers' predictions will be used for grades in exams stopped by the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Premier League restart date to be pushed back; Uefa warns clubs
description: The restart date for the Premier League will be pushed back on Friday - while Uefa warns ending competitions early could lead to clubs forfeiting European places.

title: Dr William Frankland, allergy scientist pioneer, dies aged 108
description: Dr William Frankland, known as "the grandfather of allergy", developed the idea of a pollen count.

title: Coronavirus: Worst-hit communities to receive charity boost
description: A trust set up after the Grenfell fire aims to raise millions for the communities worst-hit by the virus.

title: Coronavirus: NHS workers offered free accommodation
description: Schemes help hospital workers who have been forced to relocate or isolate from their families.

title: The Gruffalo author Julia Donaldson shows her characters social distancing
description: Julia Donaldson and illustrator Alex Sheffler help children understand the regulations in new images.

title: Edgbaston to become drive-through coronavirus test centre
description: The Edgbaston site in Birmingham will become a drive-through centre for NHS workers.

title: BBC offers biggest online education push 'in its history'
description: Schoolchildren will be offered online videos, quizzes, podcasts and articles on core subjects.

title: MOTDx: Callum Hudson Odoi on recovery, Tiger King and Sancho's Fifa
description: Chelsea's Callum Hudson-Odoi tells MOTDx's Josh Denzel about his recovery from coronavirus and how he's living his life in isolation.

title: BBC Sport's five things to do today
description: Our team give you something to read, watch, try, listen and take - all in one place.

title: Big quiz: Can you name every Premier League top scorer?
description: In the first of BBC football's bumper quiz of the week, we want you to name every Premier League top scorer.

title: Coronavirus: Where will be the last place to catch Covid-19?
description: Some places are yet to record a case - but what will they do if and when it arrives?

title: Coronavirus: Dressing up for bin night 'brings a smile' in Australia
description: Australians are having fun with fancy dress videos, bringing some relief to the stresses of lockdown.

title: The Papers: Test pledge as government admits to virus mistakes
description: The government's pledge to increase testing to 100,000 a day by the end of month dominates the front pages.

title: ‘I just had a baby - now I’m going to the frontline’
description: A nurse in NYC ended her maternity leave early to help her colleagues on the frontline.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Making rapid life-and-death decisions
description: Covid-19 cases have been filling wards at Bradford Royal Infirmary, and leaving staff with tough decisions to make.
